str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From agon; to struggle, literally, figuratively, or genitive case.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Most of all, especially. Neuter plural of the superlative of an apparently primary adverb mala; most or particularly.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
